result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael John Mccue

records.addlTxt:
11:24 a.m.  Defense counsel requests contested, in person preliminary hearing.  Good cause found to toll time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 11/17/22, 11:30 a.m., Br. 3.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 10-20-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Initial appearance is reset to 09-26-22 at 1:30 p.m. to allow public defender more time to appoint counsel.   Defendant is allowed a one time contact with the residence with the aid of law enforcement after 48 hours to obtain personal belongings.    
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael John Mccue
Current: 101 School Street, Sheboygan Falls, WI 53085 United States  (Effective: 08-29-2022)
Prior: 627 7Th St, Kiel, WI
RE:  Intimidation of a victim-dvo, on 08-10-22.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 08-11-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of intimidation of a victim/witness and disorderly conduct.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-29-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with M.E.P., DOB: 02-12-1994, or the residence of 627 7th Street, Kiel, WI.  The Court will allow a one time contact with the residence, with the aid of law enforcement, after the 72 hour no contact provision has expired, to obtain personal belongings.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTSO.
Minutes.
